summary: This document is an email chain from August 15-16, 2019, regarding the status of surveillance cameras at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It details camera outages and reporting procedures, and is significant as it originates from the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held before his death.

keyFacts: On August 16, 2019, 23 out of 161 surveillance cameras at MCC New York were reported as out of service, a 14.3% outage rate.
A new directive required daily status updates on cameras in key units (SHU, Unit 2, PCU, 10 South) to be sent to senior staff by 3:00 PM.
The email chain documents internal operational procedures at the correctional facility just days after Jeffrey Epstein's death there on August 10, 2019.
Technical staff reported ongoing work to label cameras correctly and test the system on generator power.
The document is part of the Epstein case files, highlighting post-incident scrutiny of facility security and surveillance.
